bc95: Functions for the NB-IoT module BC95.
bc95.attach:
Attach to the mobile network. May take up to 30s.
Waits for 1s between checks.
bc95.attach|param|tries: the number of tries to wait for connection, eg: 6
bc95.init: Initialize BC95 module. The serial port and generic settings.
bc95.init|param|rate: the new baud rate, eg: BaudRate.BaudRate9600
bc95.init|param|rx: the new reception pin, eg: SerialPin.C16
bc95.init|param|tx: the new transmission pins, eg: SerialPin.C17
bc95.send:
Send the actual message, encoded. Data is encoded in message pack format:
INT[DeviceId]BYTES[Message]. The maximum message size is 504 bytes.
If messages are encrypted, the key is 16 bytes: [SECRET,ID,SECRET,ID].
bc95.sendNumber: Send a number to the backend server. Encodes key/value as a json message.
bc95.sendOk:
Check if the last send operation was successful.
Also reset the status.
bc95.sendString: Send a string to the backend server. Encodes key/value as a json message.
bc95.send|param|receivePort: the local port to receive a response
bc95.setAPN: Configure the APN to use for the NB-IoT messaging.
bc95.setAPN|param|apn: the access point name, eg: internet.nbiot.telekom.de
bc95.setAPN|param|password: a password to access the APN
bc95.setAPN|param|user: a user name to access the APN
bc95.setEncryption:
Set encryption mode. Whether data should be AES encrypted. See #showDeviceInfo
how to identify the device ID and secret.
ATTENTION: Only works if BLUETOOTH is enabled!
bc95.setEncryption|param|encrypted: whether the data should be encrypted, eg: false
bc95.setServer: Configure the server to use for the NB-IoT messaging.
bc95.setServer|param|host: the IP address of a server to send messages to
bc95.setServer|param|port: the port to send messages to, eg: 9090
bc95.showDeviceInfo: Show Calliope device id and the secret for communication.
